reviews.review: Rise and shine, Mister Freeman. Rise and... shine. Not that I... wish to imply you have been sleeping on the job. No one is more deserving of a rest, and all the effort in the world would have gone to waste until... well, let's just say your hour has... come again. The right man in the wrong place can make all the difference in the world. So, wake up, Mister Freeman. Wake up and... smell the ashes...

Pretty good game. Never finished it but the story didn't seem all that bad and the gameplay was just as good. The game is super cheap too so you can't go wrong with getting it honestly.

From a design perspective HL2 is astounding. The HL series is to games what the original Star Wars trilogy is to film. I just beat HL2 for the first time in 10 years, on hard this time, and oh my word. While it's not the best game ever as some people think, it was an absolutely joyous experience. A bit of a slow burner for the first few chapters, but that is really the only non-nitpick criticism I have. The amount of little tiny details that went into this game is astounding even today.

May I also mention the soundtrack to die for? Kelly Bailey, you brilliant, brilliant man.
Pick up that can.

A big surprise. 

Of course I've  heard over the years that Half life 2 was one of the best first person shooters ever, but for whatever reason I just never got around to trying it. When I started playing for the first time I was slightly put off by the first few minutes of walking through hallways and alleys unarmed and with nothing happening, but then when things opened up and I got my first gun, I was blown away by just how good and satisfying the gun-play is! for a game that's more than 20 years old it still holds up very very well. Sure, the graphics are dated and the physics engine a bit clumsy but if you're looking to sit down and clear your mind and just enjoy gunning down some bad guys for a few hours at a time this game truly delivers. 

I highly recommend this game to anyone who like me, hasn't taken a look at it, you wont be disappointed. 



P.S. For those who are concerned with performance, I played the game on an acer aspire E15 Laptop and got a rock solid 280FPS on the highest settings without a single issue.

ДОСТОИНСТВА:
Увлекательный сюжет великолепная графика Отличный геймплей.
НЕДОСТАТКИ:
просто быть не может!
Как и ожидалось - продолжение саги о путешествиях физика - теоретика Гордона Фримена будет иметь довольно продолжительный, оригинальный и ни с чем не сравнимое продолжение. Как обычно, нашему любимому главному герою предстоит спасти ситуацию из полного краха, и при этом выжить. 
как обычно, с монтировкой в руках Гордон борется с различной нечистью - зомби и комбайнами и при этом старается спасти людей, подвергающихся полному геноциду со стороны Альянса - инопланетной организации, держащей под контролем данную территорию. 
Продолжительный и увлекательный сюжет, содержащий в себе юмор, перестрелки и множество оружия и кровопролития не оставит никого равнодушным. 
Увлекательный и фантастичный сюжет Half Life не оставит равнодушным никого.

Услышал об этой игре еще в далёком детстве, но руки всё никак не дотягивались до неё. Недавно всё же решил пройти халфу вместе с эпизодами и не пожалел. Уже насладился сюжетом и выбил все ачивы, игра очень атмосферная, чего только стоит композиция Triage At Dawn... Первая игра, в которой мне не хочется менять графон на современный, мне он нравится такой, какой он есть. Настоятельно рекомендую пройти халфу всем, кто ещё не прошёл её! 10 монтировок из 10.
P.S Вполне заслуживает звания Любимое детище.

Como não puxar o saco deste game? Ele se recusa a envelhecer... Ainda é bonito em 2019 e o gameplay se segura muito bem. A trilha sonora e a estória são muito boas e a "mixagem" entre ação, estória e puzzles é perfeita. O game suporta ultra wide melhor do que muito jogo da geração atual. E vale lembrar que quando este game foi lançado, os consoles PS3 e Xbox 360 ainda nem existiam... Nota 10
Что скажу игра хорошая,советую всем поиграть!

game

SPOILER WARNING FOR THE GAME

On november 16th, 2004, we got what we asked for. Half life 2. Everyone was hyped. People watched the trailer over and over.
It had contributed so much to the gaming community. It shows what modern gaming can do.

5 years later, i was a kid and i had no idea what half life was. I was stuck watching minecraft, playing minecraft. Watching lets plays, watching skits. Remember ItsJerryAndHarry? They contributed so hard to my life with a simple 12 second joke and is the reason why i'm here. It feels to me like a fever dream to me. Something unreal. Something that never happened and my brain made to link the 2 eras of me together. I have to find it.

Half life 2 is a game made for the Source engine, and for a game from 2004, it still holds up. Something about the source engine... appeals to me. Appeals to all of us. With never before seen level of physics, ragdolls, and level of detail, it's been classed as one of the best games ever, or atleast the most influential. Rise and shine, Mr. Freeman. Rise and... shine.

It's funny how this minecraft youtuber who had a fixation on FARTS managed to kickstart my gaming career with a simple clip, really. But i digress. I found [b] [i] it. [/i] [/b] https://youtu.be/7wXaeq1E1kg?t=4m28s
Play it again. Did you see it? They jokingly transitioned into tf2. For most people, this would fly under the radar. But for me...

No one is deserving of a rest until... well. Let's just say your hour has... come again. So.
Wake up and smell the ashes. 
Since i was not fueled by hype and just got the game and episodes for Garry's Mod, this review will be cold. Nostalgia goggles NONEXISTANT. The bandaid is off.
Half life 2 begins 20 years after half life 1 and the combine have invaded the earth. Freeman teleports onto the train and departs. He is "interrogated" by Barney and then set free. Gordon gets caught in an apartment raid but is rescued by Alyx and lead to Kleiner's lab. The teleport goes haywire and you end up outside the window of the lab. Gordon is instructed to go to Black Mesa East.

This 10 second clip. I wonder who i could've been if it weren't for these 10 seconds. I asked my dad "what is that?" and "can i play that?". The rest is history. My steam account is created, i used the same profile picture from incredimail and i downloaded Team Fortress 2 in 2013 and i found my true purpose: [b] GAMING. [/b]

Gordon goes through an action sequence with Metrocops, finds out how explosive barrels work, optionally how to crouch jump (over the ramp with boom barrels), chain reactions, and then eventually Aux Power. I. Hate. AUX POWER. It limits your ability so much that it feels like being stuck in a 1x1 room. Fortunately, there is a built in stress reliever. Shoot the glass, throw stuff through the glass, it's so breakable! Fun fact: This next water scene and the next water scene are the only times you can sprint underwater. Get ready for inconspicuous ladder extravaganza. Fun fact: you can softlock yourself at the see-saw scene by throwing the cinderblocks away. You're not missing much other than manhacks.

I started playing tf2. It was like a caveman discovering the iPhone. I had unlocked a new era of gaming. A new me. I started server hopping. Slender, deathrun, x10, sandbox, stop that tank, tr_walkway, cp_orange, dodgeball, tf2ware, jump, prophunt, instagib, etc.. Then i found my dream game. Garry's Mod. I wanted it. I wanted it for 1-2 years straight.

Fast forward to Water Hazard. You drive your airboat around like an action sequence, but then you get slammed by a giant door. Okay, you go through the obstacle course of combine and you slam it open. Action sequence resumes then you get slamemd by another giant door. You look at ways to get up. 1. the fenced area which is fenced off, and 2. the thing that looks like stairs, which is too high to get to. You fumble around until you realize you gotta go the other way. You go through and WHAT IS THIS CAR BARRCADE AND WHY IS IT ON FIRE AND HOW DO I GO THROUGH IT. At this point i just skipped to the next chapter.

2 years later, i had done it. I finally received the funds to buy garry's mod. The chains were off. I had unlocked the rest of the gaming community. Now i had 2 things in my hand. 1. Garry's mod. It has limitless potential. You could do anything in that.
And 2. I could now purchase videogames without a fuss. Before, i had a Pair, but now i have a Full House.

Turns out the lighting in Black Mesa East is broken. I had to play the rest of half life 2 on mat_fullbright 1 in my original playthrough.
Here, you get the gravity gun, which you'll basically forget about after the tutorial because REAL GUNS DO IT BETTER.
And then you go to ravenholm. Ravenholm is arguably the best chapter, but it still falls short sometimes. There's no real sense of direction, some windows can be entered, some are grigori only, and the lighting never shows where you have to go. It's also dark, so good luck managing your aux power with sprint and flashlight.

I can't really remember what happened after gmod. I had begun working my way up the ranks, buying games, making it big. I made dupes. I played around. I met sascha, i met ectobiologist15, i started interacting more with player20hh. I remember making my first friend. It was on an achievement server on a map that is now decommisioned (achievement_factory) and i was just generally messing about, trying all the different things on it. This is it. Overtime.

Highway 17 is the most boring chapter out of all of the chapters. You drive around with your jeep and sometimes you have no idea what you need to do. The lighting is broken here too. Not much to say other than the crane was a wasted idea.

I grew out of TF2. I was attracted to games like Counter strike, rainbow six siege, and such. People change. I started hanging out with Ecto and co. It was status quo. Nothing i could do. I had no other connections.

After sandtraps (yes i skipped sand traps) is nova prospekt. Wouldn't you know it, it has broken lighting! Gordon fights combine and keeps accidentally teamkilling antlions breaking shit in nova prospekt.
Entanglement: Gordon and Alyx team up again as they rescue eli and mossman from nova prospekt. Hooray.
Anticitizen One: it is pretty fun, second best chapter but it's still confusing where you have to go (with bricked doorways and such)
Follow freeman: Gordon goes out on a date with Barney. Or something.

Our Benefactors + Dark Energy: It's actually pretty fun flinging combine around with your physgu- i mean super gravity gun. Just remember to host_timescale 30 dr breen's wild ride. Gordon fucks with the citadel and kills dr bren.


"Tell me Dr. Freeman if you can. You have destroyed so much. What is it that you have created? Can you name even one thing? I thought not."
Half Life 2 does not hold up that well in 2019. Lighting issues, lack of direction, and lack of replayability without mods plague the game. My story had almost the same pace as half life 2. A fast beginning, then slowing down and down until a screeching halt.

Rather than give you the illusion of choice, i will choose for you. 
No, i do not recommend this game in 2019.

I had me a lovely time playing it with fast paced gameplay and a riveting storyline with a wonderfully eerie atomosphere that is nice and creepy at times, But I will admit it was a rather tedious affair at certain points, and after all these years, the stuck Alyx glitch still made the Nova Prospekt level nearly unplayable (forcing more than a few reloads), but with that said, I do agree, HL2 is fucking amazing, 9/10.
